thread.title: You can now check your Uber passenger score using the smartphone app
thread.title_full: You can now check your Uber passenger score using the smartphone app | DailyTelegraph

author: Michael Morrow
title: You can now check your Uber passenger score using the smartphone app
text:
IF you’ve used Uber you’ll know that you have to score the driver, but have you ever thought about what they score you?
Hidden deep within the smartphone app’s settings, Uber now offers a way to find out what your past drivers really thought of you.
Previously you would need to email the app’s support team to find out your rating.
 If you’re daring enough to look, here’s how you can figure it out.
- Go into the Uber app
-In the upper left, click the Uber menu
-Click on “Help”
-Click on “Account”
-Click “I’d like to know my rating”
-Hit submit
Uber will then send you an email within about 15 minutes with your overall rating.
Result ... 4.7? I’ll take that... “At Uber, riders rate their experience at the end of every trip, and drivers do the same,” the company says on their website.
“Uber regularly reviews that feedback and, through this process, we’re able to create and maintain a safe and respectful environment for riders and drivers in more than 200 cities around the world.
“An Uber user is able to see a driver’s rating after the driver has accepted a ride request.”
Uber ... Just like the rating for the drivers, the passenger rating is on a scale of one to five. What your Uber driver thinks about you
